definition: height (of person)/length of clothing from shoulders to bottom (tailor or dressmaker's measure)
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: A dachshund is a dog from Germany with a very long body and short legs.
sentences.chinese: 達克斯是一種身長腿短的德國狗。
肯當時還引進了身長18米的鉸接式公交車。

sentences.english: His short legs were not in proportion to his long body.
sentences.chinese: 他的短腿和他的身長不成比例。

sentences.english: She’s also more than a foot long now.
sentences.chinese: 她現在身長也超過了一英尺。

sentences.english: The finely detailed, the hasty, length short legs feeling.
sentences.chinese: 前文細緻詳盡，後文有些倉促，身長腿短的感覺。

sentences.english: The insect called the water boatman is two millimeters long.
sentences.chinese: 它就是身長只有兩毫米的劃蝽。

sentences.english: Your baby now weighs in at a little more than a pound and measures about 11 inches.
sentences.chinese: 寶寶現在重量有一磅多點了，身長約11英寸。

sentences.english: It was over 30 feet in length and had a 2500 - horsepower engine.
sentences.chinese: 它的車身長30英尺，有一個2500馬力的發動機。

sentences.english: He stands 6-4 with a wingspan of nearly 80 inches.
sentences.chinese: 他站直身長6英尺4英寸，雙臂伸張近80英尺。

sentences.english: Slightly shorter in length and armholes are cut low.
sentences.chinese: 身長略短，手臂處開口很低。

sentences.english: The missing dog has short legs and a long body.
sentences.chinese: 那條走失的狗身長腿短。

sentences.english: The heaven lord therefore blamed him and came out on his body 500 festers .
sentences.chinese: 天神怪罪下來，使妙莊王全身長了500個大膿瘡。

definition: BWH, abbr. for a woman's three measurements, namely: bust 胸圍|胸围[xiong1 wei2], waist 腰圍|腰围[yao1 wei2] and hip 臀圍|臀围[tun2 wei2]
unit of area equal to 100 畝|亩[mu3] or 6.67 hectares/a short while/a little while ago/circa. (for approximate dates)
Miyagi prefecture in the north of Japan's main island Honshū 本州[Ben3 zhou1]
to regulate/rules and regulations/regulatory/style and structure (esp. of building)
Hyōgo prefecture in the midwest of Japan's main island Honshū 本州[Ben3 zhou1]
to apologize for an offense/to offer one's apology for a fault
ODA Nobunaga (1534-1582), Japanese shogun (warlord), played an important role in unifying Japan
